item.title: ジュリアン・アサンジは英国から米国への身柄引き渡しの上訴に敗れたが、英国や欧州人権裁判所に上訴の道がある（Katharine Gemmell/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Katharine Gemmell / Bloomberg:
Julian Assange loses an appeal to his extradition from the UK to the US, but has an avenue for appeal in the UK and the European Court of Human Rights  —  WikiLeaks chief Julian Assange has lost the latest attempt to appeal his extradition to the US to face criminal spying charges …

item.title: 韓国のエンターテインメント業界では、Netflixの支配力とグローバル配信への依存によって、Netflixが地元の配給会社に対して優位に立つことを懸念する声もある（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Some in South Korea's entertainment industry worry that Netflix's dominance and relying on its global distribution give Netflix an edge over local distributors  —  Despite a wave of international interest in South Korean film and television, the stock prices of many of the country's production companies have been in a slump.

item.title: 650K以上の「オーディエンス・セグメント」を含む広告プラットフォームXandrのデータベースは、データブローカーがオンラインとオフラインの活動を監視して消費者を分類する方法を示しています（The Markup）。
item.description:
The Markup:
A database on ad platform Xandr containing 650K+ “audience segments” shows how data brokers classify consumers by surveilling their online and offline activity  —  A spreadsheet on ad platform Xandr's website revealed a massive collection of “audience segments” …

item.title: Foxの上級幹部ラジ・シャーが同局を退社、トランプ大統領の元副報道官だったシャーは、ドミニオン訴訟でテキストメッセージが暴露された（Oliver Darcy/@oliverdarcy）
item.description:
Oliver Darcy / @oliverdarcy:
Senior Fox executive Raj Shah has left the network; Shah, a former deputy press secretary under President Trump, had text messages exposed in the Dominion suit  —  News in @ReliableSources: Senior Fox executive Raj Shah is OUT at the company, I'm told. Shah's brand protection efforts, which translated to pushing Fox News in an even more pro-Trump direction after the 2020 election, were exposed in the Dominion suit. https://view.newsletters.cnn.com/ ...

item.title: WGAのストライキによる経済的影響について、ハリウッドの地理的限界や主要プレイヤーの収入源を超える可能性があるとする専門家がいる（The Messenger）
item.description:
The Messenger:
A look at the WGA strike's financial impact, which some experts say may extend beyond Hollywood's geographical limits and the major players' revenue streams  —  The financial repercussions of the writers strike extend beyond the geographical confines of Hollywood and the wallets of the industry's major players, experts say

item.title: 米上院議員6人が超党派でソーシャルメディアの透明性向上法案を再提出、広告ライブラリやモデレーション統計などの共有を企業に義務付ける（John Perrino/Tech Policy Press）
item.description:
John Perrino / Tech Policy Press:
Six US senators reintroduce a bipartisan bill to improve social media transparency, requiring companies to share ad libraries, moderation stats, and more  —  John Perrino is a policy analyst at the Stanford Internet Observatory.  —  The Platform Accountability and Transparency Act (PATA) …

item.title: ウクライナは、2014年からグローブ・アンド・メール紙に勤務しているフォトジャーナリストのメディア資格の更新を拒否し、嘘発見器テストを受けるよう要求した（Nathan VanderKlippe/Globe and Mail）。
item.description:
Nathan VanderKlippe / Globe and Mail:
Ukraine refuses to renew media credentials for a photojournalist who has worked for The Globe and Mail since 2014, after demanding he take a lie detector test  —  The Ukrainian government has failed to renew the media accreditation for a photojournalist who has worked with The Globe and Mail since 2014 …

item.title: [スレッド】インサイダーの労働組合、スト7日目にしてオーナーのアクセル・シュプリンガーと過半数出資者のKKRに書簡、経営陣に労働者との交渉を促す (@insiderunion)
item.description:
@insiderunion:
[Thread] Insider's union, on Day Seven of a strike, writes owner Axel Springer and its majority stake owner KKR, urging management to bargain with workers  —  Today, our bargaining committee sent two letters to groups with meaningful influence on Insider: Axel Springer and KKR. We asked them to encourage Insider to give us reasonable counters, a key move toward ending our ULP strike. Here are the letters and their key points: (1/6)

item.title: [スレッド】Morning Consultがニュースルームを "解散 "し、アナリストチームをより重視する。
item.description:
Jeremy Barr / @jeremymbarr:
[Thread] Morning Consult is “dissolving” its newsroom and putting more emphasis on its analyst team; the changes will impact 2.4% of the company's employees  —  Some news: I've learned that @MorningConsult is “dissolving” their small newsroom, and will be putting more emphasis on the company's analyst team. About 7 people from the newsroom will be laid off, and then 8 will be given a chance to transition from journalists to analyst team

item.title: クリス・リヒトのCNN在任期間は、絶望的ではあったが、デジタルへの移行に希望を与えたCNN+を維持していれば、違った結果になっていたかもしれない（Alex Sherman/CNBC)
item.description:
Alex Sherman / CNBC:
Chris Licht's CNN tenure could have turned out differently if he kept CNN+, which was likely doomed but represented hope for the network's transition to digital  —  - CNN is seeking a new CEO after Chris Licht left the company following a series of missteps.

item.title: 手紙：LAタイムズギルドによると、組合はワークシェアリングプランのようなレイオフの代替案を検討しただろうが、経営陣は「警告も議論もなかった」（LAタイムズギルド）。
item.description:
L.A. Times Guild:
Letter: the LA Times Guild says the union would have considered layoff alternatives, like a work-sharing plan, but management offered “no warning or discussion”  —  Since the Los Angeles Times Guild started negotiating our new contract in September, our bargaining committee has met …

item.title: Netflixが「House of Cards」をリリースしたことで始まった「Peak TV」の終焉と、より幅広い魅力を持つテレビ番組の復活の可能性について、ハリウッド関係者が考察する（Vulture）
item.description:
Vulture:
Hollywood insiders reflect on the end of “Peak TV”, kickstarted by Netflix releasing House of Cards, and the possible return of TV shows with broader appeal  —  If you call a slew of Hollywood's most powerful showrunners, studio chiefs, agents, and operators and ask them to describe …

item.title: クリス・リヒトの退社により、米国の主要な報道機関はすべて女性が率いることになった：CNN、ABCニュース、MSNBC、NBCニュース、CBSニュース、Foxニュース、NYT、WaPo、Reuters、WSJ（Jane Thier/Fortune)
item.description:
Jane Thier / Fortune:
Chris Licht's exit means all major US news organization are now led by women: CNN, ABC News, MSNBC, NBC News, CBS News, Fox News, NYT, WaPo, Reuters, and WSJ  —  IA DIPASUPIL/GETTY IMAGES FOR NEW YORK MAGAZINE  —  CNN announced on Wednesday that its chairman and CEO Chris Licht is leaving …

item.title: Googleは、2020年10月に初めて発表したNews Showcaseを、5つのローカルニュース協会との提携とともに、今年の夏以降に米国で開始する予定です（William Turvill/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
William Turvill / Press Gazette:
Google plans to launch News Showcase, first announced in October 2020, in the US later this summer, alongside partnerships with five local news associations  —  Partner publications include the Wall Street Journal, AP, Reuters and Bloomberg.  —  Google will launch the US edition …

item.title: ニューヨークの刑務所を運営する機関が、収監中の作家、ジャーナリスト、アーティストが許可なく出版することを制限していた規則を取り消す（Chris Gelardi/New York Focus)
item.description:
Chris Gelardi / New York Focus:
The agency that runs New York's prisons rescinds its rules that restricted incarcerated writers, journalists, and artists from publishing without permission  —  The policy and its sudden reversal will be among Acting Commissioner Anthony Annucci's last acts.  —  STAY FOCUSED  —  Submit
